summary:
Ongoing Disclosure Notice - Key Points:
- Director: Alistair Douglas Petrie (Controller of shares via Bartel Holdings Limited).
- Transaction Type: Acquisition of 161,564 TRA ordinary shares via Dividend Reinvestment Plan.
- Total Consideration: NZD $1,067,938.04.
- Post-Transaction Holding: 12,027,586 shares (via Bartel) + 40,011 shares (beneficial).
- Closed Period Trading: Yes (no prior clearance details provided).

(Material as per related-party interest change, but no immediate trading/capital impact noted.)

Capital Change Notice Summary (Performance Rights Issuance):
- Instrument Issued: 164,657 Performance Rights (convertible to ordinary shares, 0.0739% dilution post-issue).
- Key Terms:
- Vesting Conditions: 50% tied to 3-year TSR compound growth, 50% to 3-year EPS growth (vesting FY2027/28).
- Lapse Conditions: If performance hurdles unmet or holder exits employment pre-vesting.
- Purpose: Long-term incentive for key executives (no cash consideration).
- Total Outstanding: 575,019 Performance Rights (no treasury stock).

No material trading or capital markets impact beyond dilution.

Synlait Milk Limited – Performance Update (30 July 2025)

  • FY25 Forecasts:
  • Underlying EBITDA: $100–110m (vs. $45.2m in FY24).
  • Underlying NPAT: Breakeven (vs. -$60.4m in FY24).
  • Reported NPAT loss: -$27m to -$40m (vs. -$182.1m in FY24).

  • Reported EBITDA: $50–68m (vs. -$4.1m in FY24).

  • Key Issues:

  • Manufacturing challenges at Dunsandel facility led to one-off costs (now resolved).
  • Targeting net debt of $300m at FY25 close.

  • Banking covenants remain compliant.

  • Next Update: Full FY25 results announced 29 September 2025.

Omitted: CEO commentary, operational details without material impact.

Key Information Summary:

  • CEO Transition: Nikhil Ravishankar (current Chief Digital Officer) appointed as new CEO, effective 20 October 2025, replacing Greg Foran.
  • Leadership Context: Succession follows a period of industry challenges; Ravishankar brings digital/tech focus and internal operational familiarity.

No material financial, trading, or capital structure impacts identified.
